704764f-a.text:
Hamilton Avenue, at Smith Street (right), looking north toward Bush Street--where buildings are being torn down-and showing the area which is being converted into the northern sector of the Belt Parkway. The white building is the Devoe and Raynolds Paint Company warehouse.
October 17, 1940
P. L. Sperr
704764f-a.folder: Hamilton Avenue & Smith Street, Brooklyn, NY

704765f-a.text:
Hamilton Avenue, east side, at Smith Street, showing plant No. 1 of the Devoe and Raynolds Company, peint manufacturers. The building was demolished later in the year to facilitate the widening of the avenue as part of the Belt Parkway.
ViCV1NReg.NIe A-1o26  September 7, 1940
P. L. Sperr
(2)
The Gowanus Canal side of the factory, seen from the south end
of the bridge.
October 23, 1940
P. L. Sperr
704765f-a.folder: Hamilton Avenue & Smith Street, Brooklyn, NY

706808f-a.text:
Smith Street towards Hamilton Avenue, fr. Centre
Street, Brooklyn.
P. L. Sperr, photographer
July 25, 190
